text: A leading American painter, sculptor, and printmaker, Frank Stella subscribed to the conviction that a picture was first an object, not a representation of something else. Toward this end, he practiced the stark geometric abstraction of Minimalism as his primary mode of expression. Form, color, and pattern were the fundamental elements of Stella's work. Commenting on his austere and depersonalized view of art, he once stated, "A painting is a flat surface with paint on it, nothing more."
title: Empress of India I
